full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 499-2 Filed 11/23/21 Page 69 of 15968 LBAAMAX3ps Rocchio - Direct 1 A. I'm sorry. I'm referring to the list of behaviors specifically that are under the category entitled "Victim Selection." 2 Q. Thank you. 3 MS. POMERANTZ: Can we turn to page 4. 4 5 Q. And directing your attention to the table on page 4, what does this table show and how does that impact your view on vulnerabilities? 6 7 A. So this table shows, again, specific behaviors that there's 8 widespread agreement in this particular group of professionals 9 that are relevant to a particular stage of the grooming 10 process. And, again, these are also behaviors that have been 11 commonly and repeatedly found to exist in the scientific 12 literature as being associated with the grooming process. 13 14 Q. And how does the information on this table compare to the 15 table we were just looking at? 16 17 A. There are similar types of behaviors that can be done in 18 the service of building a relationship of trust and attachment, 19 and in -- and have been found to be utilized by offenders. But 20 there was not as much agreement among the professionals that 21 these specific behaviors -- about the relevance of these 22 specific behaviors and/or the stage to which they were part of. 23 MS. POMERANTZ: Thank you. Ms. Durocher, we can pull 24 that down. 25 Q. Dr. Rocchio, the defense has stated that your opinion that SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00007937
